item.title: Fallout Season 1 Episodes Available for Free on YouTube
item.content:encoded:
Amazon Prime Video is releasing all of Fallout’s Season 1 episodes on its official YouTube channel for free.

Fallout Season 2 is already coming to a close, with episode 8 set to release this week; check out Insider Gaming’s guide for the latest release date and start times. As we wait for the season finale, Prime Video is giving away freebies to build hype for the upcoming episode.

Fallout Season 1, Episodes 1 and 2, Are Already Out on YouTube

If you head over to the official Prime Video YouTube channel, you will see that there is a brand new category called Fallout Season 1 Full Episodes. They uploaded episode 1, “The End,” and episode 2, “The Target,” yesterday, with more to follow as we approach the Season 2 finale release date. Check out the release schedule for all Fallout Season 1 Episodes on YouTube below:

Fallout Season 1 Episode Release Schedule for YouTube

  • Season 1 Episode 1 “The End” – January 28, 5 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 2 “The Target” – January 28, 6 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 3 “The Head” – January 29, 5 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 4 “The Ghouls” – January 29, 6 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 5 “The Past” – January 30, 5 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 6 “The Trap” – January 30, 6 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 7 “The Radio” – January 31, 5 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 8 “The Beginning” – January 31, 6 PM PT

In other news, the creators of the beloved Fallout mod are not interested in remaster projects. Fallout 3 and New Vegas remakes are not releasing anytime soon, according to a new claim. What are your thoughts on Fallout Season 1 episodes becoming available for free on YouTube? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Nintendo’s response to “leaked” Nintendo Switch Online GameCube games. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: When Does Battlefield 6 Season 1 End? Battlefield 6 Season 2 Start Times & Date
item.content:encoded:
The community has had an explosive time with Battlefield 6 Season 1, but the time will come for it to make way for Season 2. Read on for full details about Battlefield 6 Season 2’s start date, times, and more.

Even though Battlefield 6‘s player base has dropped quite dramatically since launch, you better believe there are still thousands (if not hundreds of thousands) of players going into battle across PlayStation, Xbox, and PC. Battlefield 6 Season 1 dropped a decent amount of content, but Season 2 is creeping over no man’s land toward us.

When Does Battlefield 6 Season 1 End?

Battlefield 6 Season 1 finally comes to an end on February 17.

This means you’ll have experienced four months of Season 1. Technically, it doesn’t mean you’ve been bereft of content for four months, as EA has slowly dripfed live-service content through mini-releases: Rogue Ops, California Resistance, Winter Offensive, and even the January 27 Frostfire Bonus Path content.

The original end date was actually supposed to be January 21, but an unexpected delay struck.

When Does Battlefield 6 Season 2 Start?

You can look forward to Battlefield 6 Season 2 starting on February 17, the same time that Season 1 ends.

If you’re a regular live-service player, you get the gist of the transition between seasons. One season ends, another begins right away. Season 1 comes to a close on February 17, and Season 2 picks up where its predecessor left off.

We’ve already started to learn about S2 aspects as well, such as a new Battlefield 6 map leaking ahead of the S2 reveal.

Battlefield 6 Season 2 Start Date & Times

Season 2 is expected to begin on February at 8 AM PT, with the start time varying in other regions.

If you have a hard time understanding time zones, or just want a quick reference about the season’s start time and date, this table has everything you need below.

It includes time zones across America, Europe, and more.

Are you ready for Season 2 to get underway? Does EA need to be delivering more content for Battlefield 6 moving forward to keep the player base strong? Share all your thoughts and more through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Also, make sure you check out the incredible numbers behind Battlefield 6 being the best-selling game of 2025.

item.title: Phasmophobia 2026 Roadmap Revealed by Devs
item.content:encoded:
The Phasmophobia devs have revealed a new roadmap for 2026 as they work towards the 1.0 update.

Phasmophobia developers, Kinetic Games, made an announcement earlier this month; however, it wasn’t related to the game. Instead, it was revealed that they are launching a new publishing label, Kinetic Publishing, which will collaborate with small teams and individual developers worldwide.

Phasmophobia Will Get New Major Updates, New Map & Reworks, and Events in 2026

According to the new blog post, the developers of Phasmophobia are planning significant updates throughout 2026, categorized into three sections: major updates, maps, and events.

Players can expect major updates, including a complete overhaul of their character, reworked horror elements, a lore update for Phasmophobia 1.0, the Nintendo Switch 2 launch, and the Unity 6 and Netcode update.

Regarding maps, the developers will initially focus on updating older maps to meet current standards. The first of these will be an improved version of Tanglewood Drive, followed by Willow Street, which is set to be released in 2026. Additionally, a new map will be introduced this year, featuring a fresh style of location for the game.

In 2026, the popular in-game community events will return, featuring Cursed Hollow, Crimson Eye, and Winter’s Jest at approximately the same times as before. Furthermore, the team is developing a new limited-time event, with details to be announced at a later date.

In other news, check out Highguard’s roadmap, which reveals an entire year’s worth of content plans. Additionally, the ARC Raiders roadmap contains four months of content, including new events, maps, ARC enemies, and more.

What are your thoughts on Phasmophobia’s 2026 roadmap? Are you excited for upcoming updates, events, and maps? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Split Fiction movie getting the first version of its script finalized. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
